title: What are the similarities between limitations and transcendence? - Quora

response.answer_text: The similarities cannot be found in the definitions of each, but they are similar in how they are being used. What I mean by this is, that you, the seeker asking the question, are aware that the spiritual realm is no illusion. On a Conscious level you know that there must much more than what many human Beings are disconnected from. You are awakening. Keep going within and asking questions. At times, try to consciously observe how the answers manifest and unfold in your Life’s story gojng froward.

limitation (noun) meaning a limiting rule or circumstance; a restriction."severe limitations on water use"LAW a legally specified period beyond which an action may be defeated or a property right does not continue.Transcendence is the act of rising above something to a superior state. ... Transcendence comes from the Latin prefix trans-, meaning "beyond," and the word scandare, meaning "to climb." When you achieve transcendence, you have gone beyond ordinary limitations.
